title: 114_hr5563
content: The Act titled "Restoring Local Control of Airports Act of 2016" allows for the restoration of local control over airports. It also addresses passenger facility charges. Section 40117(b) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to allow for any amount in paragraph (1), remove paragraph (4), and redesignate paragraphs (5), (6), and (7) as paragraphs (4), (5), and (6) respectively. Additionally, adjustments are made in paragraphs (5) and (6) to specify the affected paragraphs. The Secretary will determine the reasonableness of a passenger facility charge if a complaint is filed within 120 days of payment. The determination will be based on whether the charge is reasonable according to specific guidelines. Regulations for the process must be established within 360 days. The Secretary will establish procedural regulations within 360 days for handling written complaints about passenger facility charges. The regulations will determine if the charges are excessive in relation to benefits or used for unauthorized purposes. The Secretary will establish procedural regulations for handling complaints about passenger facility charges, including directions for refunds or credits to passengers, issuing a determination within 270 days, and dismissing or assigning complaints within 90 days. The matter regarding passenger facility charge complaints will be assigned to an administrative law judge for handling in accordance with regulations to ensure a timely resolution within 270 days. The judge must issue a recommended decision within 90 days, and if the Secretary does not issue a final order within the 270-day period, the judge's decision will be considered final. The Airport Improvement Program is outlined in Section 3. The funding for the Airport Improvement Program is amended to $2,950,000,000 for fiscal years 2016 through 2021. Section 47114 of title 49, United States Code, is also amended to adjust apportionments accordingly. The reduction in funding for airports with high boardings and charges over $4.50 is determined based on projected revenues, with a maximum reduction of 100 percent of the amount that would be apportioned under the section. For airports in Hawaii, the reduction is also 100 percent of projected revenues from the charge. For airports in Hawaii, the reduction is also 100 percent of projected revenues from the charge. The text chunk discusses adjustments to funding percentages based on passenger boardings and charges at airports. In section 47117, amendments are made to increase the percentage from 0.25 to 1.0 and adjust fiscal years. Additionally, in section 47117(e)(1)(C), the funding amount is reduced from $3,200,000,000 to $2,950,000,000. SEC. 4. REDUCTION IN AIRLINE TICKET TAX. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to reduce the airline ticket tax from 7.5 percent to 7.0 percent, effective for transportation after September 30, 2016.
